name: Apex City Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Apex City Hotel for a belated Valentines romantic 2-night get away, and found it a mixed bag.
reviews.title: Avoid Room 4115

reviews.text: On the first night we stayed in room 4115 - a Superior Kings Size: on arrival we had difficuly operating the TV, with three remote controls to operate: one for sound; one for channels and the third to confuse.
reviews.title: Fantastic service, what more could you ask for!

reviews.text: That night we were then kept awake by the noise from a kitchen extractor fan/generator in a ajoining plant room, so in the morning we complained that the noise was unacceptable, and the receptionsit offered that either a maintence engineer would visit the room and sort the problem or we would be moved to an equivalent quality room, so could we pack our bags in case we were moved.
reviews.title: Over priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On return from a fantastic day (the hotel location is absolutely perfect, set in the Grassmarket) we asked at reception the verdict of room 4115, and were told the maintenance engineer had visited the room and found no noise... So we went to our room, and immediately heard the noise, so called the reception and asked to see the Duty Manager. 2-minutes later the reception phoned back to say that we had been moved afterall, and did we see our bags missing - we had already been moved. So I went to reception to pick up the new key card for room 4137
reviews.title: Not quite what i had expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room 4137. Perfect, a bit bigger than room 4115, no noise, and one TV remote control worked sound and channels. Hooray.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I decided to book this hotel after reading all the reviews. And it didn't disappoint us at all! the hotel doesn't look big from the outside ( compare to their sister hotel next door, at first we were thinking if we should have book the international apex instead) but as soon as we entered the hotel we knew it was right for us.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is cosy and we love the shower!
reviews.title: Really helpful staff. Good price for the city centre

likes.disliked: — Slight smell of smoke in the room - which soon cleared.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in is fast and hassle free, but the lady in reception kinda freaks us a little ( she was on the phone with someone and the entire hall can hear the conversation).
reviews.title: loved the Apex

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staffs were friendly and very very helpful. We were looking for a shop in old town, while checking it with the bar staff they were very kindly to Google it and even print the map for us! we had the nicest cocktail ever and the service just first class!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: We had our breakfast in the ground floor restaurant. The buffet is great and the service was excellent. My partner asked for full Scottish breakfast and I went for the buffet. Dinner was great too. The waitress was very friendly and chatty, we end up having 2 bottle of wine!
reviews.title: Great location, good facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a weekend break in Wee Edinburgh. There is so much to say about the hotel and the place I don’t know where to start!
reviews.title: what more could you ask for!?

reviews.text: We booked the Apex City hotel as it was a good price and a good location to everything. We booked on the hotel website, which is were we found the cheapest price, coz if you go to the booking section and make sure you click on the ‘pre-booking discount’ tab you will get a cheaper price (please be aware that there are T/C apply to this)
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: As our flight was getting in at 8 am and checking in wasn’t until (I think) 2pm, we asked if we could have an early check in – which didn’t seem too much of a problem.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, highly recommend!

likes.liked: — Clean, modern, great location in the middle of the city, free internet access
likes.disliked: — Nothing - I enjoyed everything about this hotel

reviews.text: We got a shuttle bus from the airport which will take you direct to the hotel and it was £15 for the two of us.
reviews.title: Great choice

likes.disliked: — the room was a lttle bit cold

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was lovely clean and modern and it was a disabled room which I thin was mainly down to the only available room for an earlier check inn, but to be honest we didn’t mind that.
reviews.title: No Complaints

reviews.text: The Apex City Hotel on the Grassmarket is an excellent place to stay whether you are a business traveller or looking for a base to exploring the city from.
reviews.title: Fantastic, as always!

reviews.text: The views of the castle are to die for!
reviews.title: Great hotel with a fantastic location
A really good hotel in Edinburgh City
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Apex City Hotel on many occassions over the past six months, and what makes it my favourite hotel in Edinburgh is the staff. They are professional, courteous and caring and go out of their way to make sure that your stay is special.
Very good hotel with excellent staff and a fantastic location - definitely recommended.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but noisy street traffic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An excellent hotel, well located in Edinburgh city for access to business and tourism sites. The hotel room was modern, spotlessly clean and well equipped. Add to this the friendly, helpful staff and a very good restaurant and I can confidently say I will use this hotel again. Note: It does not offer smoking rooms which will appeal to many but was personally disappointing.
reviews.title: Apex City Fantastic Hotel

description: In the heart of Edinburgh’s Old Town, this contemporary hotel has 119 stylish rooms. Designed for comfort, rooms include HD widescreen LCD TV, large desk, free Wi-Fi and local calls, ground coffee and selected teas, luxury toiletries, iron and ironing board. Facilities include Agua Bar and Restaurant, event space for up to 80 delegates, use of leisure facilities a few doors away at Apex International including pool, tropicarium and gym.
